column3: The original comic book Superman could only leap tall buildings in a single bound.

column1: The First Computer Was Invented in the 1940s
column3: Originally built at the University of Pennsylvania’s School of Engineering, in 1946, ENIAC weighed 60,000 pounds and took up a room larger than most studio apartments (1,500 square feet).
According to some former astronauts, space does have a distinct odor that hangs around when they come back in the ship after a spacewalk. They’ve described it as “hot metal” or “searing steak.”

column1: The Loch Ness is the national animal of Scotland
column3: While Scotland proudly boasts the Loch Ness Monster, one of the world’s most famous fabled creatures, the country opted to make another mythical beast its national animal: the unicorn.

column1: Do bees sometimes sting other bees?
column3: In protecting their hives from outsiders, some “guard bees” will stay by the entrance and sniff the bees that come in.
